page.title: 16Leisure in Swineshead
page.content: Most leisure pursuits have to be done outside the village as the village is too small to maintain many clubs. Within the village, a table tennis club is run at the village hall during the winter. In the nearby village of Pertenhall every month the Women's Institute meet and ladies from the surrounding villages are invited to go along. Each month a speaker is invited to come along and give a talk on any subject from cake decoration to a recent visit to Holland. Towards the end of 1983 the Stodden Churches Mother's Unionwas formed. This is in addition to the existing Swineshead and Pertenhall Mother's Union. The aim was to start a group with fairly young young people being involved. They meet once a month and discuss various topics relating to moral and christian thoughts.
